result.execSummary:
The defendant John Lindsay Hilsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense), Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell February 25, 2015 - Amend JOC removing 346.65(2)(g).


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton, DF:  John Lindsay Hilsen appeared. Includes 14CF234 and 14TR3338. ADA Sortedahl recites agreement and joint recommendation. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one, OWI 4th. Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1 in 14CF234. Court dismisses 14TR3338. Court orders - S/W 2 years probation with conditions:
- 60 days in St. Croix County Jail, with good time. Credit for 20 days time served. 
- $1494.00 fine to be paid through probation. 
- $984.28 restitution to Jason Reed. Apply bond on file and remaining to be paid through probation. 
- 24 month license revocation with credit for any administrative suspension
- 24 month ignition interlock device
- AODA and follow all recommendations. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is advised of right to appeal.
filed by ADA Ken Sortedahl. ks
signed by Def. & Atty this date. eif
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton, DF: John Lindsay Hilsen appeared.  Court called at 1:11 p.m.  Includes case 14CF234 & 14TR3338.  Set for Plea/Sentencing.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form with the court. ADA Sortedahl advises the court there is an agreement.  State recites the agreement.  Court questions DE if he would like to do this after the holidays.  DE agrees.  Continue Plea/Sentencing hearing.  Bond continues in form and amount.  Court adjourned at 1:18 p.m.  lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton, DF:  John Lindsay Hilsen appeared. Includes 14CF234 and 14TR3338. More time is needed to review offer. Court sets out. Defendant is participating in treatment. Address is confirmed and bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton, DF:  John Lindsay Hilsen appeared. Includes 14CF234 and 14TR3338. Atty Sortedahl updates the Court on status and requests more time for discovery and negotiations. Def is in treatment at this time. Court enters a not guilty plea on 14TR3338. Bail continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on August 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Matthew L Hartung, DF ATTY:  Joseph R Caton, DF:  John Lindsay Hilsen appeared. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  No speedy trial demand. Def is going for an evaluation on 7/28/14. Defendant to post add'l $250.00 by Thursday. Atty Caton requests a PTC out 60 days. Bond continues.  sf  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Filed by ADA Sortedahl. km
David Huehm 14R 008883. hl
Filed by ADA Sortedahl. km
signed by Defendant and Atty this date. eif
Arraignment on July 7, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

CASH BOND applies to COUNT 1. Defendant to post $500.00 before release and the balance of $250.00 within 14 days (of posting the first $500.00).

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
- Defendant to continue with AODA follow through and successful discharge. 

and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $5,000.00 on COUNT 2 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jason R.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Alexis S Mckinley, DF ATTY:  Joseph R Caton,  DF:  John Lindsay Hilsen appeared from jail. Defendant has completed an AODA intake approx 3 weeks ago. Bond continues, as modified.  Arraignment scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jason R.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
